creator: rinku24@yahoo.com
text: I am running jmeter 2.3.1 with one thread group having 3 HTTP request and 4th request as a XML-RPC request (without Send SOAPAction selected) with XML data. First 3 requests reuses the same connection but 4th XML-RPC creates new connection insted of reusing same connection.
It's blocking my load testing as it requires to reuse the connection.
creator: rinku24@yahoo.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
A work-round is to use the HTTP Sampler to send the XML data as well.

This is not a blocker as far as JMeter is concerned.

Actually, it appears that the SOAP/XML-RPC sampler does re-use the same connection if it can.

However, for this to happen, you must use exactly the same protocol, host and port settings, and you must use the HTTPClient sampler.
creator: sebb@apache.org
rinku24@yahoo.com
text: Thanks Sebb.  Both of your work arounds are working fine.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text: In that case, it's not a bug at all...
